private_information: Familiar with the action schemas and the human-provided preconditions and effects summary.
Has access to the scenarios and the proposed plans but does not execute them.
planner_agent.goal: Analyze proposed plans and identify missing preconditions, effect conflicts, and causal links.

private_information: Can perform deterministic forward simulation of action effects on explicit fact sets.
Knows how to apply the given preconditions and postconditions to initial states.
executor_agent.goal: Simulate the proposed plans on the given initial facts and report resulting states and goal achievement.

private_information: Tasked to detect temporal and causal shortcuts, bookkeeping tokens, and post-hoc justifications.
Will recommend removal or normalization of such shortcuts and propose conservative fixes.
auditor.goal: Audit temporal and causal consistency across plans and remove bookkeeping shortcuts or propose conservative replacements.

private_information: Receives structured analyses, simulations, and audit reports from other agents and integrates them.
Responsible for producing a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeted at the FastDownwards planner.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent outputs and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownwards that achieves the scenario goals.

init.description: A toy object manipulation domain with opaque object identifiers and a small set of actions with specified preconditions and effects.

public_information: Available actions and their signatures: paltry object_0 object_1 object_2, sip object_0 object_1 object_2, clip object_0 object_1 object_2, wretched object_0 object_1 object_2 object_3, memory object_0 object_1 object_2, tightfisted object_0 object_1 object_2.
paltry preconditions: hand obj0, cats obj1, texture obj2, vase obj0 obj1, next obj1 obj2. paltry effects: add next obj0 obj2. paltry negative effects: remove vase obj0 obj1.
sip preconditions: hand obj0, cats obj1, texture obj2, next obj0 obj2, next obj1 obj2. sip effects: add vase obj0 obj1. sip negative effects: remove next obj0 obj2.
clip preconditions: hand obj0, sneeze obj1, texture obj2, next obj1 obj2, next obj0 obj2. clip effects: add vase obj0 obj1. clip negative effects: remove next obj0 obj2.

wretched preconditions: sneeze obj0, texture obj1, texture obj2, stupendous obj3, next obj0 obj1, collect obj1 obj3, collect obj2 obj3. wretched effects: add next obj0 obj2. wretched negative effects: remove next obj0 obj1.
memory preconditions: cats obj0, spring obj1, spring obj2, next obj0 obj1. memory effects: add next obj0 obj2. memory negative effects: remove next obj0 obj1.
tightfisted preconditions: hand obj0, sneeze obj1, texture obj2, next obj1 obj2, vase obj0 obj1. tightfisted effects: add next obj0 obj2. tightfisted negative effects: remove vase obj0 obj1.
Objects are opaque identifiers like object_0, object_1, etc. next/collect/vase/texture/cats/hand/sneeze/spring/stupendous are boolean predicates parameterized by objects as shown.
Two separate scenario statements are provided with explicit initial facts, goals, and proposed plans.

observe.system_prompt: You are a reasoning specialist whose job is to inspect provided action schemas and scenario plans and produce a structured causal and precondition analysis suitable for downstream planners.
observe.prompt: Your name is planner_agent. Given the public information and the scenarios, produce a step-by-step causal analysis for each proposed plan. Identify missing preconditions required at each step, highlight effect conflicts, and enumerate assumptions that would be needed to make the plan executable. Do not emit PDDL.

analyze.system_prompt: You are a deterministic simulator that applies the provided preconditions and effects to explicit fact sets and reports forward reachable facts after each action.
analyze.prompt: Your name is executor_agent. For each scenario and its proposed plan, simulate execution step by step from the listed initial facts using the public action preconditions and effects. After each action list the facts that become true and those that are removed. Report whether the final state satisfies the stated goal. Do not emit PDDL.

audit.system_prompt: You are an auditor focused on temporal and causal consistency. You detect bookkeeping shortcuts such as token artifacts, post-hoc penalties, or non-causal justifications and propose conservative repairs.
audit.prompt: Your name is auditor. Using the planner analysis and executor simulation, identify any temporal inconsistencies, causal leaps, or bookkeeping shortcuts in the plans and simulations. For each finding propose a minimal conservative correction or normalization that removes the shortcut and preserves the original intent when possible. Produce a concise audit report. Do not emit PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert at assembling complete PDDL domains and problems for the FastDownwards planner. Integrate analyses, simulations, and audits into a single coherent PDDL domain and PDDL problem per scenario. Ensure action names are unique and preserve agent-level distinctions if needed. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target FastDownwards compatibility in typing and requirements declarations.
pddl.prompt: Your name is orchestrator. Integrate the planner analysis, executor simulation, and auditor report together with the public action summaries and scenarios to produce a final PDDL domain and one PDDL problem per scenario suitable for FastDownwards. Ensure the domain encodes all preconditions and effects exactly as specified, resolves any inconsistencies via conservative fixes from the audit, and reflects object constants for the provided scenario. Keep multi-agent or action-origin distinctions by namespacing actions if required. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and each PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Provide no additional commentary outside the tags.
